subject: Re: [junit] ordering of testCases.
msgSnippet: ... Why not just use JUnit? :) suite := new TestSuite() suite.addTest(new MyTest( test1 )); suite.addTest(new MyTest( test2 )); OrderedTestSuite -- whether
messageBody:
Pardey, Craig wrote:

> Use the junit-addons
> http://junit-addons.sourceforge.net/junitx/framework/OrderedTestSuite.html

Why not just use JUnit? :)

suite := new TestSuite()
suite.addTest(new MyTest("test1"));
suite.addTest(new MyTest("test2"));

OrderedTestSuite -- whether JUnit-addons' version or GSBase's version --
helps you control the order of /some/ of the tests in your test suite,
but if you want to control the order of /all/ the tests in your test
suite, then JUnit has supported that since day 1.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
